output.conclusion: By completing this course, you've gained a foundational understanding of nutrition science. You are now equipped to make informed dietary choices and continue exploring the fascinating world of nutrition for a healthier lifestyle.
output.introduction: Welcome to Nutrition Science for Beginners! This course will provide you with a basic understanding of essential nutrients, their roles in the body, and how to make healthy food choices. Each module is designed to be concise and easy to understand, taking approximately 5 minutes to read.

chapters.description: What is nutrition science? Why is it important for health? Basic concepts and definitions.
Introduction to carbohydrates, proteins, and fats. Their primary functions in the body.
Overview of essential vitamins and their roles in maintaining health. Focus on Vitamin A, C, and D.
Introduction to essential minerals like calcium, iron, and potassium. Their importance for bodily functions.
How to read and interpret food labels. Identifying key information like serving size, calories, and nutrient content.
Tips for making informed food choices based on nutritional needs. Balancing macronutrient and micronutrient intake.

modules.moduleTitle: Practical Nutrition: Food Labels and Choices

chapters.description: The role of water in the body. Recommended daily intake and sources of hydration.
What constitutes a balanced diet? Incorporating all food groups for optimal health.
